<h1 className={"openapi__heading"}>Estimate AMM bounds</h1>

<MethodEndpoint method={"get"} path={"/api/v2/estimate/amm/bounds"}></MethodEndpoint>



Get a list of AMMs or filter by market ID, party ID or AMM ID

## Request

<details style={{"marginBottom":"1rem"}} className={"openapi-markdown__details"} data-collapsed={false} open={true}><summary style={{}}><h3 className={"openapi-markdown__details-summary-header-params"}>Query Parameters</h3></summary><div><ul><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Base price of the AMM pool, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly\nformatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.","in":"query","name":"basePrice","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Upper price of the AMM pool, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly\nformatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.","in":"query","name":"upperPrice","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Lower price of the AMM pool, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly\nformatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.","in":"query","name":"lowerPrice","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Leverage at the upper price of the AMM pool.","in":"query","name":"leverageAtUpperPrice","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Leverage at the lower price of the AMM pool.","in":"query","name":"leverageAtLowerPrice","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Amount of the asset that the party is willing to commit to the AMM pool.","in":"query","name":"commitmentAmount","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"description":"Market ID to estimate the AMM for.","in":"query","name":"marketId","required":false,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem></ul></div></details><div><div><ApiTabs label={undefined} id={undefined}><TabItem label={"200"} value={"200"}><div>

A successful response.

</div><div><MimeTabs className={"openapi-tabs__mime"} schemaType={"response"}><TabItem label={"application/json"} value={"application/json"}><SchemaTabs className={"openapi-tabs__schema"}><TabItem label={"Schema"} value={"Schema"}><details style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details response"} data-collapsed={false} open={true}><summary style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details-summary-response"}><strong>Schema</strong></summary><div style={{"textAlign":"left","marginLeft":"1rem"}}></div><ul style={{"marginLeft":"1rem"}}><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"ammError"} required={false} schemaName={"EstimateAMMBoundsResponseAMMError (string)"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** [`AMM_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED`, `AMM_ERROR_COMMITMENT_BELOW_MINIMUM`, `AMM_ERROR_LOWER_BOUND_TOO_WIDE`, `AMM_ERROR_UPPER_BOUND_TOO_WIDE`, `AMM_ERROR_BOTH_BOUNDS_TOO_WIDE`]"} schema={{"description":"If populated the bounds could be calculated but the AMM is invalid for other reasons.","default":"AMM_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED","enum":["AMM_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED","AMM_ERROR_COMMITMENT_BELOW_MINIMUM","AMM_ERROR_LOWER_BOUND_TOO_WIDE","AMM_ERROR_UPPER_BOUND_TOO_WIDE","AMM_ERROR_BOTH_BOUNDS_TOO_WIDE"],"type":"string","title":"EstimateAMMBoundsResponseAMMError"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"liquidationPriceAtLower"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Estimated price below the lower bound at which the commitment will be lost.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"liquidationPriceAtUpper"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Estimated price above upper bound at which the commitment will be lost.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"lossOnCommitmentAtLower"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Loss of commitment at the lower bound.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"lossOnCommitmentAtUpper"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Loss of commitment at the upper bound.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"positionSizeAtLower"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Theoretical volume at the top of the lower bound.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"positionSizeAtUpper"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"description":"Theoretical volume at the top of the upper bound.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem></ul></details></TabItem><TabItem label={"Example (from schema)"} value={"Example (from schema)"}><ResponseSamples responseExample={"{\n  \"ammError\": \"AMM_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED\",\n  \"liquidationPriceAtLower\": \"string\",\n This string must contain at least\none \"/\" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent\nthe fully qualified name of the type (as in\n`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form\n(e.g., leading \".\" is not accepted).\n\nIn practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they\nexpect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the\nscheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type\nserver that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:\n\n* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.\n* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]\n  value in binary format, or produce an error.\n* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the\n  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any\n  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved\n  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage\n  breaking changes.)\n\nNote: this functionality is not currently available in the official\nprotobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with\ntype.googleapis.com.\n\nSchemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be\nused with implementation specific semantics.","type":"string"}}></SchemaItem><li><div style={{"fontSize":"var(--ifm-code-font-size)","opacity":"0.6","marginLeft":"-.5rem"}}>]</div></li></div></details></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"message"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"string"}}></SchemaItem></ul></details></TabItem><TabItem label={"Example (from schema)"} value={"Example (from schema)"}><ResponseSamples responseExample={"{\n  \"code\": 0,\n  \"details\": [\n    {\n      \"@type\": \"string\"\n    }\n  ],\n  \"message\": \"string\"\n}"} language={"json"}></ResponseSamples></TabItem></SchemaTabs></TabItem></MimeTabs></div></TabItem><TabItem label={"default"} value={"default"}><div>
